Detailed Description

View which is able to draw the frame of a window including the window title.

XYDIM WindowFrameView::GetSoftkeyBarHeight (   )  const [inline]
 

Obsolete - the softkeybar has been replaced by the panel since APOXI-1.8.

XYDIM WindowFrameView::GetTitleHeight (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the height of the title in pixels. Note that the outer frame of the window is not part of the title.

const TextFormat& WindowFrameView::GetTitleTextFormat (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the textformat used for the window title. Derived views may set the text format in their constructor by invoking WindowFrameView::SetTitleTextFormat().

BOOLEAN WindowFrameView::IsActive (  const Control &  control  )  const
 

Returns TRUE, if the frame should be shown in the active mode which usually means that the frame has the focus. It is recommended that the implementation of the methods WindowFrameView::DrawWindowExtensions and WindowFrameView::DrawControlFrame use this method instead of just asking 'BOOLEAN is_active = control.HasFocus()', as WindowFrameView::IsActive includes some optimizations which prevent flickering when switching the focus between applications.

void WindowFrameView::SetSoftkeyBarHeight (  XYDIM  height  )  [inline, protected]
 

Obsolete - the softkeybar has been replaced by the panel since APOXI-1.8.

void WindowFrameView::SetTitleHeight (  XYDIM  height  )  [inline, protected]
 

Sets the height of the title in pixels. Note that the outer frame of the window is not part of the title.

void WindowFrameView::SetTitleTextFormat (  const TextFormat &  text_format  )  [inline, protected]
 

Sets the textformat used for the window title.
